name: Break-Out
overview: A Breakout/Pong style game released in DatorMagazin 1988/12. Then it was time for a challenge again! This week, it's games like grids. You scoundrel, you should write a Break-Out! They are an old classic game that involves using a bouncing ball to remove as many tiles as possible at the top of the screen. The game has existed in many versions throughout the ages, most recently as Crack, Krak-out and Arkanoid. You control a small plate in the lower part of the screen with the help of which you hit the bouncing ball in the air, the plate is controlled sideways with the keys X and Z. When the ball hits a cradle, a tile, or the court, it must bounce in principle according to the laws of physics, i.e. the angle of incidence, output signal. However, a certain random factor can be added to the bounce to make the game better. So enjoy!
